alert.note: Alert for Broward (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 24 at 12:35PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following counties, Broward and Palm Beach. * WHEN...Until 230 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1235 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Lauderdale, Pompano Beach, Boca Raton, Deerfield Beach, Tamarac, Margate, Lighthouse Point, Coconut Creek, Oakland Park, North Lauderdale, Palm Aire, Twin Lakes, Boca Pointe, Village Park, Boca Del Mar, North Pompano Beach, Pompano Beach Airport and North Andrews Gardens. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
